chessosisnbproject.logic

Class SUM

  • java.lang.Object
    • chessosisnbproject.logic.SUM

  • public class SUM
extends Object
    SUM (Static Utility Methods) is a sort of a lightweight library or collection of static methods needed by other classes. No objects of type SUM should be instantiated as the class contains only static members.
    Author:
    Henrik Lindberg

    • Method Detail

      • pseudoLegalAccess

        public static EnumSet<Square> pseudoLegalAccess(Square sq,
                                                Position pos)
                                         throws Exception
        Used to determine the pieces of the active color that have "pseudo-legal" access to the square specified by the first parameter. The main use of the method is checking the legality of a newly generated position. If any piece of the active color has pseudo-legal access to the square of the enemy king (i.e., can capture it), then the position is illegal and the move leading to it should be discarded from the list of legal move candidates.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to which access will be determined
        pos - the context
        Returns:
        the set of pieces that have pseudo-legal access to the given square
        Throws:
        Exception

      • bitboardToSqSet

        public static EnumSet<Square> bitboardToSqSet(long bitboard)
                                       throws Exception
        Converts a bitboard-based square set representation to a Square EnumSet-based one. This method is the inverse function of squareSetToBitboard.
        Parameters:
        bitboard - the Java long to convert
        Returns:
        a Square EnumSet
        Throws:
        Exception - might be thrown in squareBitToSquare()

      • squareSetToBitboard

        public static long squareSetToBitboard(EnumSet<Square> squareSet)
                                throws Exception
        Converts a Square EnumSet-based square set representation to a bitboard-based one. This method is the inverse function of bitboardToSquareSet.
        Parameters:
        squareSet - the Square EnumSet to convert
        Returns:
        a bitboard
        Throws:
        Exception - in case the parameter receives null

      • squareBitToSquare

        public static Square squareBitToSquare(long squareBit)
                                throws Exception
        Square bit to enum type Square conversion method.
        Parameters:
        squareBit - Java long to convert
        Returns:
        a Square constant; should never return null
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of an invalid square bit

      • validSquareBit

        public static boolean validSquareBit(long bitboard)
        Determines whether a bitboard is a square bit. A square bit (bitboard) has exactly one bit set. In other words, its a value 2^n where n is between 0 and 63.
        Parameters:
        bitboard - the bitboard to examine
        Returns:
        true when bitboard is a square bit

      • splitBitboardIntoSetOfSquareBits

        public static Set<Long> splitBitboardIntoSetOfSquareBits(long bitboard)
        Splits a bitboard into its square bit "elements". For example, a bitboard with the decimal value 7 (first three bits set) would result in a set of three square bits with the values 1, 2 and 4. The size of the set is in all cases equal to the number of set bits in the bitboard.
        Parameters:
        bitboard - the bitboard to split
        Returns:
        a set of square bits

      • numberOfSetBits

        public static int numberOfSetBits(long bitboard)
        Counts the number of set bits in a bitboard.
        Parameters:
        bitboard - a bitboard with 0 to 64 set bits
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 64

      • randomSquare

        public static Square randomSquare()
        Returns a random Square constant.
        Returns:
        random Square constant

      • fileOfSquare

        public static long fileOfSquare(Square square)
        Returns the CSS.FILE_? constant that corresponds to the file the Square parameter is located on.
        Parameters:
        square - the square to operate on
        Returns:
        one of the CSS.FILE_? constants

      • rankOfSquare

        public static long rankOfSquare(Square square)
        Returns the CSS.RANK_? constant that corresponds to the rank the Square parameter is located on.
        Parameters:
        square - the square to operate on
        Returns:
        one of the CSS.RANK_? constants

      • adjacentSquare

        public static Square adjacentSquare(Square square,
                                    Direction direction)
                             throws Exception
        Each square on the board has at most eight adjacent squares as illustrated by the following diagram (using E4 as the square for the method's first parameter). 
         +--------------+       N
 | D5 | E5 | F5 |       ^
 |---------------       |
 | D4 | E4 | F4 |  W {--+--} E
 ----------------       |
 | D3 | E3 | F3 |       v
 +--------------+       S
        View the bitboard index diagram at the beginning of CSS.java to get an idea on how the method accomplishes its task.
        Parameters:
        square - the square to operate on
        direction - the direction of the adjacent square
        Returns:
        the adjacent square or null if no such square exists
        Throws:
        Exception

      • resolvePiece

        public static Piece resolvePiece(Square sq,
                                 Position pos)
        Returns the piece located on the square argument or null if the square is empty. Strictly speaking the method returns an enum constant that identifies the type and color of the piece.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to examine
        pos - the context
        Returns:
        the piece found on the square

      • resolvePieceColor

        public static Colour resolvePieceColor(Square sq,
                                       Position pos)
        Resolves the color of the piece found on the square parameter or null if it is empty.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to examine
        pos - the context
        Returns:
        the color of the piece or null

      • resolvePieceType

        public static PieceType resolvePieceType(Square square,
                                         Position position)
        Determines the type of chessman located on the given square. Possible values include PAWN, BISHOP, KNIGHT, ROOK, QUEEN and KING. If the square parameter is an empty square, the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        square - the square to examine
        position - the context
        Returns:
        the type of the chessman on the square

      • unicodeChessSymbolTable

        public static String[][] unicodeChessSymbolTable(Position pos)
        Returns a two-dimensional String array that is used in drawing the chess pieces (which are actually characters) seen on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to operate on
        Returns:
        a table of characters representing the input position

      • tableCellToSquare

        public static Square tableCellToSquare(int row,
                                       int col)
        Returns the square name that corresponds to a given cell in an 8-by-8 table. The cell is identified by the row and col parameters. For example, tableCellToSquare( 0, 0 ) would return Square.A8 and tableCellToSquare( 7, 7 ) Square.H1
        Parameters:
        row - the row (or chessboard rank)
        col - the column (or chessboard file)
        Returns:

      • splitFENIntoFields

        public static String[] splitFENIntoFields(String fEN)
                                   throws Exception
        Used to split a FEN string into its six constituent fields.
        Parameters:
        fEN - the FEN string to split
        Returns:
        a String array of six elements
        Throws:
        Exception

      • splitFirstFENField

        public static String[] splitFirstFENField(String firstFENField)
                                   throws Exception
        Splits the first field of a FEN string into eight parts. Each of these parts represents a rank on the chessboard along with the pieces placed on it. As an example consider the standard starting position:

        rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR

        Parameters:
        firstFENField - the first field of a FEN string
        Returns:
        a String array representing the eight ranks of the board
        Throws:
        Exception

      • fENRanksToBBArray

        public static long[] fENRanksToBBArray(String[] fENRanks)
                                throws Exception
        Converts the eight ranks of the FEN strings' first field into an array of 12 bitboards. Both the eight ranks and the 12 bitboards are a means to express the same thing -- the piece placement of the board.
        Parameters:
        fENRanks - the first field of a FEN string
        Returns:
        an array of 12 bitboards that expresses piece placement on the board
        Throws:
        Exception

      • bitIndexToSquareBit

        public static long bitIndexToSquareBit(int index)
                                throws Exception
        Returns the square bit at a particular bit index.
        Parameters:
        index - The bit index of a 64-bit integer (an int between 0 and 63).
        Returns:
        A square bit, i.e., a bitboard with a single bit set.
        Throws:
        Exception - In case of an invalid index.
